name: Sifat-E-Sadakin
experience: Over 20 years of experience in the culinary industry

recipes.name: Biriyani
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices for at least an hour
2. Cook the rice with whole spices
3. In a separate pan, cook the marinated chicken until browned
4. Layer the rice and chicken in a large pot
5. Cover and cook over low heat until the rice is cooked through
6. Serve hot with raita and chutney

recipes.name: Pitha
recipes.method:
1. Mix together the rice flour, coconut, jaggery, and cardamom to make a dough
2. Shape the dough into small balls or patties
3. Heat some oil in a pan and fry the pitha until golden brown
4. Serve hot or cold

recipes.name: Chapati
recipes.method:
1. Mix together the flour, water, and salt to make a dough
2. Knead the dough until smooth and elastic
3. Divide the dough into small balls
4. Roll out each ball into a thin circle
5. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat
6. Cook the chapati on the skillet, flipping once, until browned on both sides
7. Brush with oil and serve hot

recipes.name: Fuchka
recipes.method:
1. Boil the chickpeas and potatoes until soft
2. Mash the chickpeas and potatoes together
3. Add spices to taste
4. Make small balls out of the mixture and deep fry in oil
5. Make a small hole in each ball and fill with tamarind chutney and cilantro chutney
6. Serve cold

name: Mridula Rahman
experience: Over 15 years of experience in the culinary industry

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the Hilsa fish with salt and turmeric powder.
2. Fry the fish in oil till golden brown on both sides and keep it aside.
3. In the same pan, add mustard paste, green chili and salt with little water and cook for few minutes.
4. Add the fried fish to the pan and cook for few more minutes.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chingri Malai Curry
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the shrimp with salt and turmeric powder.
2. Fry the shrimp in oil till golden brown and keep it aside.
3. In the same pan, fry onion, ginger, garlic and green chili for few minutes.
4. Add coconut milk, salt, sugar and little water and bring it to boil.
5. Add the fried shrimp to the pan and cook for few more minutes.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Rui Macher Jhol
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the Rohu fish with salt and turmeric powder.
2. Fry the fish in oil till golden brown and keep it aside.
3. In the same pan, fry onion, ginger, garlic and green chili for few minutes.
4. Add tomato, potato, salt and turmeric powder and cook for few minutes.
5. Add water and bring it to boil.
6. Add the fried fish to the pan and cook for few more minutes.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Rashida Akter
experience: Over 20 years of experience in cooking traditional Bengali dishes

recipes.name: Shorshe Bata Chingri
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the shrimp with salt and turmeric powder.
2. Fry the shrimp in oil till golden brown and keep it aside.
3. In the same pan, add mustard paste, green chili and salt with little water and cook for few minutes.
4. Add the fried shrimp to the pan and cook for few more minutes.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Kachkolar Kofta Curry
recipes.method:
1. Boil the raw banana and mash it.
2. Mix the mashed banana with chickpea flour, salt, turmeric and little water to form small balls.
3. Fry the balls in oil till golden brown and keep it aside.
4. In the same pan, fry onion, ginger, garlic and green chili for few minutes.
5. Add salt, sugar and little water and bring it to boil.
6. Add the fried balls to the pan and cook for few more minutes.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Mutton Tehari
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the mutton with salt and turmeric powder.
2. Fry the mutton in oil till brown and keep it aside.
3. In the same pan, fry onion, ginger, garlic and green chili for few minutes.
4. Add rice, salt, turmeric powder and cook for few minutes.
5. Add water and bring it to boil.
6. Add the fried mutton to the pan and cook for few more minutes.
7. Serve hot with salad and chutney.

name: Nasreen Ahmed
experience: Over 25 years of experience in cooking traditional Chittagonian dishes

recipes.name: Shutki Bhorta
recipes.method:
1. Soak the dried fish in water for 20-30 minutes.
2. Fry the dried fish in mustard oil.
3. Mash the fried fish and add chopped onion, green chili and salt.
4. Mix all the ingredients together and mash it again.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Bhuna Khichuri
recipes.method:
1. Wash the rice and moong dal and soak them in water for 30 minutes.
2. Fry the onion, garlic, ginger and green chili in oil till the onion turns golden brown.
3. Add salt, turmeric powder and garam masala and fry for a minute.
4. Add the soaked rice and moong dal and fry for 5 minutes.
5. Add water and bring it to a boil.
6. Cook on medium heat till the rice and dal are fully cooked.
7. Serve hot with egg curry or chicken curry.

recipes.name: Chitol Macher Muitha
recipes.method:
1. Boil the chitol fish with salt and turmeric powder till it is cooked.
2. Drain the water and mash the fish.
3. Boil the potato and mash it.
4. Fry the onion, garlic, ginger and green chili in oil till the onion turns golden brown.
5. Add the mashed fish, mashed potato, salt and turmeric powder and fry for a few minutes.
6. Add water and bring it to a boil.
7. Cook on medium heat till the water evaporates and the mixture becomes dry.
8. Make small balls out of the mixture and steam for 10-15 minutes.
9. Serve hot with tomato chutney or green chili chutney.

name: Mohammad Rahman
experience: Over 19 years of experience in cooking authentic SeaFood

recipes.name: Chittagong Fish Curry
cooking_method: Clean and wash the fish fillet, and cut them into desired size pieces.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish pieces until they are golden brown. Set aside.
In the same pan, add sliced onion and sauté until they are translucent.
Add ginger paste and garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomato and cook until it is soft and mushy.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to taste. Mix well.
Add water and bring the mixture to a boil.
Add fried fish pieces and cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat.
Add garam masala and mix well.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chittagong Prawn Curry
cooking_method: Heat oil in a pan and sauté sliced onion until it is translucent.
Add ginger paste and garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add chopped tomato and cook until it is soft and mushy.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to taste. Mix well.
Add water and bring the mixture to a boil.
Add prawns and cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat.
Add garam masala and mix well.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Rui Macher Jhol
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the Rohu fish with salt and turmeric powder.
2. Fry the fish in oil till golden brown and keep it aside.
3. In the same pan, fry onion, ginger, garlic and green chili for few minutes.
4. Add tomato, potato, salt and turmeric powder and cook for few minutes.
5. Add water and bring it to boil.
6. Add the fried fish to the pan and cook for few more minutes.
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Mohammad Ali
experience: Over 07 years of experience in the street of Dhaka

recipes.name: Fuchka
recipes.cooking_method: Mix mashed potatoes, chopped onions, and spices together. Fill the fuchka shells with the mixture. Dip the fuchkas in the tamarind water and garnish with coriander leaves.

recipes.name: Jhalmuri
recipes.cooking_method: Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. Add spices like chaat masala, salt, and chili powder. Mix well and serve.

recipes.name: Bhelpuri
recipes.cooking_method: Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. Add spices like chaat masala, salt, and chili powder. Mix well and serve.

name: Tahmina Begum
experience: Over 13 years of experience in traditional Bengali Cuisine

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
cooking_method: Mix together the mustard seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, salt and sugar.
Add 2-3 tablespoons of water to the spice mix to make a thick paste.
Rub the paste onto the Ilish fish slices and let it marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish slices until they are golden brown on both sides. Set aside.
In the same pan, add the green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add the remaining spice mix and sauté for a minute.
Add water and bring the mixture to a boil.
Add the fried fish slices and cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Bhuna Khichuri
cooking_method: Soak the rice and split mung beans in water for 30 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pressure cooker and sauté the sliced onion until it is translucent.
Add ginger paste, garlic paste and chopped green chilies and sauté for a minute.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder and salt to taste. Mix well.
Add the soaked rice and mung beans and sauté for a few minutes.
Add water and pressure cook until it is cooked and soft. Let the pressure release naturally.
Add garam masala powder and mix well.
Serve hot with any side dish of your choice.

recipes.name: Biriyani
recipes.method:
1. Marinate the chicken in yogurt and spices for at least an hour
2. Cook the rice with whole spices
3. In a separate pan, cook the marinated chicken until browned
4. Layer the rice and chicken in a large pot
5. Cover and cook over low heat until the rice is cooked through
6. Serve hot with raita and chutney
